DataElement.preferredName: Johns Hopkins Frailty Assessment Calculator Past 30 Days Average Amount Have Felt Unusually Weak Indicator Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated response, over the past month, on average, of how they have been feeling unusually weak, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Johns Hopkins Frailty Assessment Calculator Past 30 Days Average Amount Have Felt Unusually Weak Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0)._A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present._The usual amount of something._A question about whether an individual has been feeling unusually weak, on the average._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0).
